  108.   // Heart Rate Measurement       0x2A37  Mandatory   Notify
  109.   // Body Sensor Location         0x2A38  Optional    Read
  110.   // Heart Rate Control Point     0x2A39  Conditional Write       <-- Not used here
  111.   hrms.begin();
  112.  
  113.   // Note: You must call .begin() on the BLEService before calling .begin() on
  114.   // any characteristic(s) within that service definition.. Calling .begin() on
  115.   // a BLECharacteristic will cause it to be added to the last BLEService that
  116.   // was 'begin()'ed!
  117.  
  118.   // Configure the Heart Rate Measurement characteristic
  119.   // See: https://www.bluetooth.com/specifications/gatt/viewer?attributeXmlFile=org.bluetooth.characteristic.heart_rate_measurement.xml
  120.   // Properties = Notify
  121.   // Min Len    = 1
  122.   // Max Len    = 8
  123.   //    B0      = UINT8  - Flag (MANDATORY)
  124.   //      b5:7  = Reserved
  125.   //      b4    = RR-Internal (0 = Not present, 1 = Present)
  126.   //      b3    = Energy expended status (0 = Not present, 1 = Present)
  127.   //      b1:2  = Sensor contact status (0+1 = Not supported, 2 = Supported but contact not detected, 3 = Supported and detected)
  128.   //      b0    = Value format (0 = UINT8, 1 = UINT16)
  129.   //    B1      = UINT8  - 8-bit heart rate measurement value in BPM
  130.   //    B2:3    = UINT16 - 16-bit heart rate measurement value in BPM
  131.   //    B4:5    = UINT16 - Energy expended in joules
  132.   //    B6:7    = UINT16 - RR Internal (1/1024 second resolution)
  133.   hrmc.setProperties(CHR_PROPS_NOTIFY);
  134.   hrmc.setPermission(SECMODE_OPEN, SECMODE_NO_ACCESS);
  135.   hrmc.setFixedLen(2);
  136.   hrmc.setCccdWriteCallback(cccd_callback);  // Optionally capture CCCD updates
  137.   hrmc.begin();
  138.   uint8_t hrmdata[2] = { 0b00000110, 0x40 }; // Set the characteristic to use 8-bit values, with the sensor connected and detected
  139.   hrmc.write(hrmdata, 2);
  140.  
  141.   // Configure the Body Sensor Location characteristic
  142.   // See: https://www.bluetooth.com/specifications/gatt/viewer?attributeXmlFile=org.bluetooth.characteristic.body_sensor_location.xml
  143.   // Properties = Read
  144.   // Min Len    = 1
  145.   // Max Len    = 1
  146.   //    B0      = UINT8 - Body Sensor Location
  147.   //      0     = Other
  148.   //      1     = Chest
  149.   //      2     = Wrist
  150.   //      3     = Finger
  151.   //      4     = Hand
  152.   //      5     = Ear Lobe
  153.   //      6     = Foot
  154.   //      7:255 = Reserved
  155.   bslc.setProperties(CHR_PROPS_READ);
  156.   bslc.setPermission(SECMODE_OPEN, SECMODE_NO_ACCESS);
  157.   bslc.setFixedLen(1);
  158.   bslc.begin();
  159.   bslc.write8(2);    // Set the characteristic to 'Wrist' (2)
  160. }
  161.  
  162. void connect_callback(uint16_t conn_handle)
  163. {
  164.   // Get the reference to current connection
  165.   BLEConnection* connection = Bluefruit.Connection(conn_handle);
  166.  
  167.   char central_name[32] = { 0 };
  168.   connection->getPeerName(central_name, sizeof(central_name));
  169.  
  170.   Serial.print("Connected to ");
  171.   Serial.println(central_name);
  172. }
  173.  
  174. /**
  175.  * Callback invoked when a connection is dropped
  176.  * @param conn_handle connection where this event happens
  177.  * @param reason is a BLE_HCI_STATUS_CODE which can be found in ble_hci.h
  178.  */
  179. void disconnect_callback(uint16_t conn_handle, uint8_t reason)
  180. {
  181.   (void) conn_handle;
  182.   (void) reason;
  183.  
  184.   Serial.println("Disconnected");
  185.   Serial.println("Advertising!");
  186. }
  187.  
  188. void cccd_callback(uint16_t conn_hdl, BLECharacteristic* chr, uint16_t cccd_value)
  189. {
  190.     // Display the raw request packet
  191.     Serial.print("CCCD Updated: ");
  192.     //Serial.printBuffer(request->data, request->len);
  193.     Serial.print(cccd_value);
  194.     Serial.println("");
  195.  
  196.     // Check the characteristic this CCCD update is associated with in case
  197.     // this handler is used for multiple CCCD records.
  198.     if (chr->uuid == hrmc.uuid) {
  199.         if (chr->notifyEnabled(conn_hdl)) {
  200.             Serial.println("Heart Rate Measurement 'Notify' enabled");
  201.         } else {
  202.             Serial.println("Heart Rate Measurement 'Notify' disabled");
  203.         }
  204.     }
  205. }
  206.  
  207. void loop()
  208. {
  209.   digitalToggle(LED_RED);
  210.   
  211.   if ( Bluefruit.connected() ) {
  212.     uint8_t hrmdata[2] = { 0b00000110, bps++ };           // Sensor connected, increment BPS value
  213.     
  214.     // Note: We use .notify instead of .write!
  215.     // If it is connected but CCCD is not enabled
  216.     // The characteristic's value is still updated although notification is not sent
  217.     if ( hrmc.notify(hrmdata, sizeof(hrmdata)) ){
  218.       Serial.print("Heart Rate Measurement updated to: "); Serial.println(bps); 
  219.     }else{
  220.       Serial.println("ERROR: Notify not set in the CCCD or not connected!");
  221.     }
  222.   }
  223.  
  224.   // Only send update once per second
  225.   delay(1000);
  226. }

BLE Pin I/O

by Thach Ha

Firmata is a generic protocol for communicating with microcontrollers and controlling the board's pins such as setting the GPIO outputs and inputs, PWM output, analog reads, etc....

Setup

In order to run this demo, you will need to open Bluefruit LE Connect on your mobile device using our free iOS, Android or OS X applications.

  • Load the StandardFirmataBLE example sketch in the Arduino IDE
  • Compile the sketch and flash it to your nRF52 based Feather
  • Once you are done uploading, open the Serial Monitor (Tools > Serial Monitor)
  • Open the Bluefruit LE Connect application on your mobile device
  • Connect to the appropriate target (probably 'Bluefruit52')
  • Once connected switch to the Pin I/O application inside the app

For more information using Pin I/O module, you could check out this tutorial here https://learn.adafruit.com/bluefruit-le-connect-for-ios/pin-i-o

Complete Code

The latest version of this code is always available on Github, and in the Examples folder of the nRF52 BSP.

The code below is provided for convenience sake, but may be out of date! See the link above for the latest code.
Download: Project Zip or StandardFirmataBLE.ino | View on Github
Copy Code 
/*
  Firmata is a generic protocol for communicating with microcontrollers
  from software on a host computer. It is intended to work with
  any host computer software package.

  To download a host software package, please click on the following link
  to open the list of Firmata client libraries in your default browser.

  https://github.com/firmata/arduino#firmata-client-libraries

  Copyright (C) 2006-2008 Hans-Christoph Steiner.  All rights reserved.
  Copyright (C) 2010-2011 Paul Stoffregen.  All rights reserved.
  Copyright (C) 2009 Shigeru Kobayashi.  All rights reserved.
  Copyright (C) 2009-2016 Jeff Hoefs.  All rights reserved.

  This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
  modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
  License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
  version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.

  See file LICENSE.txt for further informations on licensing terms.

  Last updated October 16th, 2016
*/

// Adafruit nRF52 Boards require Firmata at least 2.5.7

#include <bluefruit.h>
#include <Servo.h>
#include <Wire.h>
#include <Firmata.h>

#define I2C_WRITE                   B00000000
#define I2C_READ                    B00001000
#define I2C_READ_CONTINUOUSLY       B00010000
#define I2C_STOP_READING            B00011000
#define I2C_READ_WRITE_MODE_MASK    B00011000
#define I2C_10BIT_ADDRESS_MODE_MASK B00100000
#define I2C_END_TX_MASK             B01000000
#define I2C_STOP_TX                 1
#define I2C_RESTART_TX              0
#define I2C_MAX_QUERIES             8
#define I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED  -1

// the minimum interval for sampling analog input
#define MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL   1

// Adafruit
uint8_t ANALOG_TO_PIN(uint8_t n)
{
  switch (n)
  {
    case 0 : return PIN_A0;
    case 1 : return PIN_A1;
    case 2 : return PIN_A2;
    case 3 : return PIN_A3;
    case 4 : return PIN_A4;
    case 5 : return PIN_A5;
    case 6 : return PIN_A6;
    case 7 : return PIN_A7;
  }

  return 127;
}


/*==============================================================================
 * GLOBAL VARIABLES
 *============================================================================*/

#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
SerialFirmata serialFeature;
#endif

BLEUart bleuart;

/* analog inputs */
int analogInputsToReport = 0; // bitwise array to store pin reporting

/* digital input ports */
byte reportPINs[TOTAL_PORTS];       // 1 = report this port, 0 = silence
byte previousPINs[TOTAL_PORTS];     // previous 8 bits sent

/* pins configuration */
byte portConfigInputs[TOTAL_PORTS]; // each bit: 1 = pin in INPUT, 0 = anything else

/* timer variables */
unsigned long currentMillis;        // store the current value from millis()
unsigned long previousMillis;       // for comparison with currentMillis
unsigned int samplingInterval = 19; // how often to run the main loop (in ms)

/* i2c data */
struct i2c_device_info {
  byte addr;
  int reg;
  byte bytes;
  byte stopTX;
};

/* for i2c read continuous more */
i2c_device_info query[I2C_MAX_QUERIES];

byte i2cRxData[64];
boolean isI2CEnabled = false;
signed char queryIndex = -1;
// default delay time between i2c read request and Wire.requestFrom()
unsigned int i2cReadDelayTime = 0;

Servo servos[MAX_SERVOS];
byte servoPinMap[TOTAL_PINS];
byte detachedServos[MAX_SERVOS];
byte detachedServoCount = 0;
byte servoCount = 0;

boolean isResetting = false;

// Forward declare a few functions to avoid compiler errors with older versions
// of the Arduino IDE.
void setPinModeCallback(byte, int);
void reportAnalogCallback(byte analogPin, int value);
void sysexCallback(byte, byte, byte*);

/* utility functions */
void wireWrite(byte data)
{
#if ARDUINO >= 100
  Wire.write((byte)data);
#else
  Wire.send(data);
#endif
}

byte wireRead(void)
{
#if ARDUINO >= 100
  return Wire.read();
#else
  return Wire.receive();
#endif
}

/*==============================================================================
 * FUNCTIONS
 *============================================================================*/

void attachServo(byte pin, int minPulse, int maxPulse)
{
  if (servoCount < MAX_SERVOS) {
    // reuse indexes of detached servos until all have been reallocated
    if (detachedServoCount > 0) {
      servoPinMap[pin] = detachedServos[detachedServoCount - 1];
      if (detachedServoCount > 0) detachedServoCount--;
    } else {
      servoPinMap[pin] = servoCount;
      servoCount++;
    }
    if (minPulse > 0 && maxPulse > 0) {
      servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attach(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), minPulse, maxPulse);
    } else {
      servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attach(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin));
    }
  } else {
    Firmata.sendString("Max servos attached");
  }
}

void detachServo(byte pin)
{
  servos[servoPinMap[pin]].detach();
  // if we're detaching the last servo, decrement the count
  // otherwise store the index of the detached servo
  if (servoPinMap[pin] == servoCount && servoCount > 0) {
    servoCount--;
  } else if (servoCount > 0) {
    // keep track of detached servos because we want to reuse their indexes
    // before incrementing the count of attached servos
    detachedServoCount++;
    detachedServos[detachedServoCount - 1] = servoPinMap[pin];
  }

  servoPinMap[pin] = 255;
}

void enableI2CPins()
{
  byte i;
  // is there a faster way to do this? would probaby require importing
  // Arduino.h to get SCL and SDA pins
  for (i = 0; i < TOTAL_PINS; i++) {
    if (IS_PIN_I2C(i)) {
      // mark pins as i2c so they are ignore in non i2c data requests
      setPinModeCallback(i, PIN_MODE_I2C);
    }
  }

  isI2CEnabled = true;

  Wire.begin();
}

/* disable the i2c pins so they can be used for other functions */
void disableI2CPins() {
  isI2CEnabled = false;
  // disable read continuous mode for all devices
  queryIndex = -1;
}

void readAndReportData(byte address, int theRegister, byte numBytes, byte stopTX) {
  // allow I2C requests that don't require a register read
  // for example, some devices using an interrupt pin to signify new data available
  // do not always require the register read so upon interrupt you call Wire.requestFrom()
  if (theRegister != I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED) {
    Wire.beginTransmission(address);
    wireWrite((byte)theRegister);
    Wire.endTransmission(stopTX); // default = true
    // do not set a value of 0
    if (i2cReadDelayTime > 0) {
      // delay is necessary for some devices such as WiiNunchuck
      delayMicroseconds(i2cReadDelayTime);
    }
  } else {
    theRegister = 0;  // fill the register with a dummy value
  }

  Wire.requestFrom(address, numBytes);  // all bytes are returned in requestFrom

  // check to be sure correct number of bytes were returned by slave
  if (numBytes < Wire.available()) {
    Firmata.sendString("I2C: Too many bytes received");
  } else if (numBytes > Wire.available()) {
    Firmata.sendString("I2C: Too few bytes received");
  }

  i2cRxData[0] = address;
  i2cRxData[1] = theRegister;

  for (int i = 0; i < numBytes && Wire.available(); i++) {
    i2cRxData[2 + i] = wireRead();
  }

  // send slave address, register and received bytes
  Firmata.sendSysex(SYSEX_I2C_REPLY, numBytes + 2, i2cRxData);
}

void outputPort(byte portNumber, byte portValue, byte forceSend)
{
  // pins not configured as INPUT are cleared to zeros
  portValue = portValue & portConfigInputs[portNumber];
  // only send if the value is different than previously sent
  if (forceSend || previousPINs[portNumber] != portValue) {
    Firmata.sendDigitalPort(portNumber, portValue);
    previousPINs[portNumber] = portValue;
  }
}

/* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 * check all the active digital inputs for change of state, then add any events
 * to the Serial output queue using Serial.print() */
void checkDigitalInputs(void)
{
  /* Using non-looping code allows constants to be given to readPort().
   * The compiler will apply substantial optimizations if the inputs
   * to readPort() are compile-time constants. */
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 0 && reportPINs[0]) outputPort(0, readPort(0, portConfigInputs[0]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 1 && reportPINs[1]) outputPort(1, readPort(1, portConfigInputs[1]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 2 && reportPINs[2]) outputPort(2, readPort(2, portConfigInputs[2]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 3 && reportPINs[3]) outputPort(3, readPort(3, portConfigInputs[3]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 4 && reportPINs[4]) outputPort(4, readPort(4, portConfigInputs[4]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 5 && reportPINs[5]) outputPort(5, readPort(5, portConfigInputs[5]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 6 && reportPINs[6]) outputPort(6, readPort(6, portConfigInputs[6]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 7 && reportPINs[7]) outputPort(7, readPort(7, portConfigInputs[7]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 8 && reportPINs[8]) outputPort(8, readPort(8, portConfigInputs[8]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 9 && reportPINs[9]) outputPort(9, readPort(9, portConfigInputs[9]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 10 && reportPINs[10]) outputPort(10, readPort(10, portConfigInputs[10]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 11 && reportPINs[11]) outputPort(11, readPort(11, portConfigInputs[11]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 12 && reportPINs[12]) outputPort(12, readPort(12, portConfigInputs[12]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 13 && reportPINs[13]) outputPort(13, readPort(13, portConfigInputs[13]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 14 && reportPINs[14]) outputPort(14, readPort(14, portConfigInputs[14]), false);
  if (TOTAL_PORTS > 15 && reportPINs[15]) outputPort(15, readPort(15, portConfigInputs[15]), false);
}

// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
/* sets the pin mode to the correct state and sets the relevant bits in the
 * two bit-arrays that track Digital I/O and PWM status
 */
void setPinModeCallback(byte pin, int mode)
{
  if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_IGNORE)
    return;

  if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_I2C && isI2CEnabled && mode != PIN_MODE_I2C) {
    // disable i2c so pins can be used for other functions
    // the following if statements should reconfigure the pins properly
    disableI2CPins();
  }
  if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin) && mode != PIN_MODE_SERVO) {
    if (servoPinMap[pin] < MAX_SERVOS && servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
      detachServo(pin);
    }
  }
  if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
    reportAnalogCallback(PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin), mode == PIN_MODE_ANALOG ? 1 : 0); // turn on/off reporting
  }
  if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
    if (mode == INPUT || mode == PIN_MODE_PULLUP) {
      portConfigInputs[pin / 8] |= (1 << (pin & 7));
    } else {
      portConfigInputs[pin / 8] &= ~(1 << (pin & 7));
    }
  }
  Firmata.setPinState(pin, 0);
  switch (mode) {
    case PIN_MODE_ANALOG:
      if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
        if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
          pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT);    // disable output driver
#if ARDUINO <= 100
          // deprecated since Arduino 1.0.1 - TODO: drop support in Firmata 2.6
          digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW); // disable internal pull-ups
#endif
        }
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
      }
      break;
    case INPUT:
// Adafruit: Input without pull up cause pin state changes randomly --> lots of transmission data     
//      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
//        pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT);    // disable output driver
//#if ARDUINO <= 100
//        // deprecated since Arduino 1.0.1 - TODO: drop support in Firmata 2.6
//        digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW); // disable internal pull-ups
//#endif
//        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, INPUT);
//      }
//      break;
    case PIN_MODE_PULLUP:
      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
        pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT_PULLUP);
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_PULLUP);
        Firmata.setPinState(pin, 1);
      }
      break;
    case OUTPUT:
      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
        if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_PWM) {
          // Disable PWM if pin mode was previously set to PWM.
          digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW);
        }
        pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), OUTPUT);
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, OUTPUT);
      }
      break;
    case PIN_MODE_PWM:
      if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin)) {
        pinMode(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), OUTPUT);
        analogWrite(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), 0);
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_PWM);
      }
      break;
    case PIN_MODE_SERVO:
      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_SERVO);
        if (servoPinMap[pin] == 255 || !servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
          // pass -1 for min and max pulse values to use default values set
          // by Servo library
          attachServo(pin, -1, -1);
        }
      }
      break;
    case PIN_MODE_I2C:
      if (IS_PIN_I2C(pin)) {
        // mark the pin as i2c
        // the user must call I2C_CONFIG to enable I2C for a device
        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_I2C);
      }
      break;
    case PIN_MODE_SERIAL:
#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
      serialFeature.handlePinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_SERIAL);
#endif
      break;
    default:
      Firmata.sendString("Unknown pin mode"); // TODO: put error msgs in EEPROM
  }
  // TODO: save status to EEPROM here, if changed
}

/*
 * Sets the value of an individual pin. Useful if you want to set a pin value but
 * are not tracking the digital port state.
 * Can only be used on pins configured as OUTPUT.
 * Cannot be used to enable pull-ups on Digital INPUT pins.
 */
void setPinValueCallback(byte pin, int value)
{
  if (pin < TOTAL_PINS && IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
    if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT) {
      Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
      digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), value);
    }
  }
}

void analogWriteCallback(byte pin, int value)
{
  if (pin < TOTAL_PINS) {
    switch (Firmata.getPinMode(pin)) {
      case PIN_MODE_SERVO:
        if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin))
          servos[servoPinMap[pin]].write(value);
        Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
        break;
      case PIN_MODE_PWM:
        if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin))
          analogWrite(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), value);
        Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
        break;
    }
  }
}

void digitalWriteCallback(byte port, int value)
{
  byte pin, lastPin, pinValue, mask = 1, pinWriteMask = 0;

  if (port < TOTAL_PORTS) {
    // create a mask of the pins on this port that are writable.
    lastPin = port * 8 + 8;
    if (lastPin > TOTAL_PINS) lastPin = TOTAL_PINS;
    for (pin = port * 8; pin < lastPin; pin++) {
      // do not disturb non-digital pins (eg, Rx & Tx)
      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
        // do not touch pins in PWM, ANALOG, SERVO or other modes
        if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT || Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == INPUT) {
          pinValue = ((byte)value & mask) ? 1 : 0;
          if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT) {
            pinWriteMask |= mask;
          } else if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == INPUT && pinValue == 1 && Firmata.getPinState(pin) != 1) {
            // only handle INPUT here for backwards compatibility
#if ARDUINO > 100
            pinMode(pin, INPUT_PULLUP);
#else
            // only write to the INPUT pin to enable pullups if Arduino v1.0.0 or earlier
            pinWriteMask |= mask;
#endif
          }
          Firmata.setPinState(pin, pinValue);
        }
      }
      mask = mask << 1;
    }
    writePort(port, (byte)value, pinWriteMask);
  }
}


// -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
/* sets bits in a bit array (int) to toggle the reporting of the analogIns
 */
//void FirmataClass::setAnalogPinReporting(byte pin, byte state) {
//}
void reportAnalogCallback(byte analogPin, int value)
{
  if (analogPin < TOTAL_ANALOG_PINS) {
    if (value == 0) {
      analogInputsToReport = analogInputsToReport & ~ (1 << analogPin);
    } else {
      analogInputsToReport = analogInputsToReport | (1 << analogPin);
      // prevent during system reset or all analog pin values will be reported
      // which may report noise for unconnected analog pins
      if (!isResetting) {
        // Send pin value immediately. This is helpful when connected via
        // ethernet, wi-fi or bluetooth so pin states can be known upon
        // reconnecting.
        Firmata.sendAnalog(analogPin, analogRead( ANALOG_TO_PIN(analogPin) ) );
      }
    }
  }
  // TODO: save status to EEPROM here, if changed
}

void reportDigitalCallback(byte port, int value)
{
  if (port < TOTAL_PORTS) {
    reportPINs[port] = (byte)value;
    // Send port value immediately. This is helpful when connected via
    // ethernet, wi-fi or bluetooth so pin states can be known upon
    // reconnecting.
    if (value) outputPort(port, readPort(port, portConfigInputs[port]), true);
  }
  // do not disable analog reporting on these 8 pins, to allow some
  // pins used for digital, others analog.  Instead, allow both types
  // of reporting to be enabled, but check if the pin is configured
  // as analog when sampling the analog inputs.  Likewise, while
  // scanning digital pins, portConfigInputs will mask off values from any
  // pins configured as analog
}

/*==============================================================================
 * SYSEX-BASED commands
 *============================================================================*/

void sysexCallback(byte command, byte argc, byte *argv)
{
  byte mode;
  byte stopTX;
  byte slaveAddress;
  byte data;
  int slaveRegister;
  unsigned int delayTime;

  switch (command) {
    case I2C_REQUEST:
      mode = argv[1] & I2C_READ_WRITE_MODE_MASK;
      if (argv[1] & I2C_10BIT_ADDRESS_MODE_MASK) {
        Firmata.sendString("10-bit addressing not supported");
        return;
      }
      else {
        slaveAddress = argv[0];
      }

      // need to invert the logic here since 0 will be default for client
      // libraries that have not updated to add support for restart tx
      if (argv[1] & I2C_END_TX_MASK) {
        stopTX = I2C_RESTART_TX;
      }
      else {
        stopTX = I2C_STOP_TX; // default
      }

      switch (mode) {
        case I2C_WRITE:
          Wire.beginTransmission(slaveAddress);
          for (byte i = 2; i < argc; i += 2) {
            data = argv[i] + (argv[i + 1] << 7);
            wireWrite(data);
          }
          Wire.endTransmission();
          delayMicroseconds(70);
          break;
        case I2C_READ:
          if (argc == 6) {
            // a slave register is specified
            slaveRegister = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);
            data = argv[4] + (argv[5] << 7);  // bytes to read
          }
          else {
            // a slave register is NOT specified
            slaveRegister = I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED;
            data = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);  // bytes to read
          }
          readAndReportData(slaveAddress, (int)slaveRegister, data, stopTX);
          break;
        case I2C_READ_CONTINUOUSLY:
          if ((queryIndex + 1) >= I2C_MAX_QUERIES) {
            // too many queries, just ignore
            Firmata.sendString("too many queries");
            break;
          }
          if (argc == 6) {
            // a slave register is specified
            slaveRegister = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);
            data = argv[4] + (argv[5] << 7);  // bytes to read
          }
          else {
            // a slave register is NOT specified
            slaveRegister = (int)I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED;
            data = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);  // bytes to read
          }
          queryIndex++;
          query[queryIndex].addr = slaveAddress;
          query[queryIndex].reg = slaveRegister;
          query[queryIndex].bytes = data;
          query[queryIndex].stopTX = stopTX;
          break;
        case I2C_STOP_READING:
          byte queryIndexToSkip;
          // if read continuous mode is enabled for only 1 i2c device, disable
          // read continuous reporting for that device
          if (queryIndex <= 0) {
            queryIndex = -1;
          } else {
            queryIndexToSkip = 0;
            // if read continuous mode is enabled for multiple devices,
            // determine which device to stop reading and remove it's data from
            // the array, shifiting other array data to fill the space
            for (byte i = 0; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
              if (query[i].addr == slaveAddress) {
                queryIndexToSkip = i;
                break;
              }
            }

            for (byte i = queryIndexToSkip; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
              if (i < I2C_MAX_QUERIES) {
                query[i].addr = query[i + 1].addr;
                query[i].reg = query[i + 1].reg;
                query[i].bytes = query[i + 1].bytes;
                query[i].stopTX = query[i + 1].stopTX;
              }
            }
            queryIndex--;
          }
          break;
        default:
          break;
      }
      break;
    case I2C_CONFIG:
      delayTime = (argv[0] + (argv[1] << 7));

      if (delayTime > 0) {
        i2cReadDelayTime = delayTime;
      }

      if (!isI2CEnabled) {
        enableI2CPins();
      }

      break;
    case SERVO_CONFIG:
      if (argc > 4) {
        // these vars are here for clarity, they'll optimized away by the compiler
        byte pin = argv[0];
        int minPulse = argv[1] + (argv[2] << 7);
        int maxPulse = argv[3] + (argv[4] << 7);

        if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
          if (servoPinMap[pin] < MAX_SERVOS && servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
            detachServo(pin);
          }
          attachServo(pin, minPulse, maxPulse);
          setPinModeCallback(pin, PIN_MODE_SERVO);
        }
      }
      break;
    case SAMPLING_INTERVAL:
      if (argc > 1) {
        samplingInterval = argv[0] + (argv[1] << 7);
        if (samplingInterval < MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL) {
          samplingInterval = MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL;
        }
      } else {
        //Firmata.sendString("Not enough data");
      }
      break;
    case EXTENDED_ANALOG:
      if (argc > 1) {
        int val = argv[1];
        if (argc > 2) val |= (argv[2] << 7);
        if (argc > 3) val |= (argv[3] << 14);
        analogWriteCallback(argv[0], val);
      }
      break;
    case CAPABILITY_QUERY:
      Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
      Firmata.write(CAPABILITY_RESPONSE);
      for (byte pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
        if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
          Firmata.write((byte)INPUT);
          Firmata.write(1);
          Firmata.write((byte)PIN_MODE_PULLUP);
          Firmata.write(1);
          Firmata.write((byte)OUTPUT);
          Firmata.write(1);
        }
        if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
          Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
          Firmata.write(10); // 10 = 10-bit resolution
        }
        if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin)) {
          Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_PWM);
          Firmata.write(DEFAULT_PWM_RESOLUTION);
        }
        if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
          Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_SERVO);
          Firmata.write(14);
        }
        if (IS_PIN_I2C(pin)) {
          Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_I2C);
          Firmata.write(1);  // TODO: could assign a number to map to SCL or SDA
        }
#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
        serialFeature.handleCapability(pin);
#endif
        Firmata.write(127);
      }
      Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
      break;
    case PIN_STATE_QUERY:
      if (argc > 0) {
        byte pin = argv[0];
        Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
        Firmata.write(PIN_STATE_RESPONSE);
        Firmata.write(pin);
        if (pin < TOTAL_PINS) {
          Firmata.write(Firmata.getPinMode(pin));
          Firmata.write((byte)Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0x7F);
          if (Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0xFF80) Firmata.write((byte)(Firmata.getPinState(pin) >> 7) & 0x7F);
          if (Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0xC000) Firmata.write((byte)(Firmata.getPinState(pin) >> 14) & 0x7F);
        }
        Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
      }
      break;
    case ANALOG_MAPPING_QUERY:
      Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
      Firmata.write(ANALOG_MAPPING_RESPONSE);
      for (byte pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
        Firmata.write(IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin) ? PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin) : 127);
      }
      Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
      break;

    case SERIAL_MESSAGE:
#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
      serialFeature.handleSysex(command, argc, argv);
#endif
      break;
  }
}

/*==============================================================================
 * SETUP()
 *============================================================================*/

void systemResetCallback()
{
  isResetting = true;

  // initialize a defalt state
  // TODO: option to load config from EEPROM instead of default

#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  serialFeature.reset();
#endif

  if (isI2CEnabled) {
    disableI2CPins();
  }

  for (byte i = 0; i < TOTAL_PORTS; i++) {
    reportPINs[i] = false;    // by default, reporting off
    portConfigInputs[i] = 0;  // until activated
    previousPINs[i] = 0;
  }

  for (byte i = 0; i < TOTAL_PINS; i++) {
    // pins with analog capability default to analog input
    // otherwise, pins default to digital output
    if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(i)) {
      // turns off pullup, configures everything
      setPinModeCallback(i, PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
    } else if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(i)) {
      // sets the output to 0, configures portConfigInputs
      setPinModeCallback(i, OUTPUT);
    }

    servoPinMap[i] = 255;
  }
  // by default, do not report any analog inputs
  analogInputsToReport = 0;

  detachedServoCount = 0;
  servoCount = 0;

  /* send digital inputs to set the initial state on the host computer,
   * since once in the loop(), this firmware will only send on change */
  /*
  TODO: this can never execute, since no pins default to digital input
        but it will be needed when/if we support EEPROM stored config
  for (byte i=0; i < TOTAL_PORTS; i++) {
    outputPort(i, readPort(i, portConfigInputs[i]), true);
  }
  */
  isResetting = false;
}

void setup()
{
  Serial.begin(115200);
  while ( !Serial ) delay(10);   // for nrf52840 with native usb

  Serial.println("Bluefruit52 Standard Firmata via BLEUART Example");
  Serial.println("------------------------------------------------\n");

  // Config the peripheral connection with maximum bandwidth 
  // more SRAM required by SoftDevice
  // Note: All config***() function must be called before begin()
  Bluefruit.configPrphBandwidth(BANDWIDTH_MAX);
  
  Bluefruit.begin();
  Bluefruit.setName("Bluefruit52");
  Bluefruit.setTxPower(4);    // Check bluefruit.h for supported values
  
  // try to go as fast as possible, could be rejected by some central, increase it if needed
  // iOS won't negotitate and will mostly use 30ms
  Bluefruit.Periph.setConnInterval(9, 24); // min = 9*1.25=11.25 ms, max = 23*1.25=30ms
  
  // Configure and Start BLE Uart Service
  // Firmata use several small write(1) --> buffering TXD is required to run smoothly
  // Enable buffering TXD
  bleuart.begin();
  bleuart.bufferTXD(true);
  
  Firmata.setFirmwareVersion(FIRMATA_FIRMWARE_MAJOR_VERSION, FIRMATA_FIRMWARE_MINOR_VERSION);

  Firmata.attach(ANALOG_MESSAGE, analogWriteCallback);
  Firmata.attach(DIGITAL_MESSAGE, digitalWriteCallback);
  Firmata.attach(REPORT_ANALOG, reportAnalogCallback);
  Firmata.attach(REPORT_DIGITAL, reportDigitalCallback);
  Firmata.attach(SET_PIN_MODE, setPinModeCallback);
  Firmata.attach(SET_DIGITAL_PIN_VALUE, setPinValueCallback);
  Firmata.attach(START_SYSEX, sysexCallback);
  Firmata.attach(SYSTEM_RESET, systemResetCallback);

  // use bleuart as transportation layer
  Firmata.begin(bleuart);

  // to use a port other than Serial, such as Serial1 on an Arduino Leonardo or Mega,
  // Call begin(baud) on the alternate serial port and pass it to Firmata to begin like this:
  // Serial1.begin(57600);
  // Firmata.begin(Serial1);
  // However do not do this if you are using SERIAL_MESSAGE

  //Firmata.begin(57600);
  //while (!Serial) {
  //  ; // wait for serial port to connect. Needed for ATmega32u4-based boards and Arduino 101
  //}

  systemResetCallback();  // reset to default config

  // Set up and start advertising
  startAdv();  
}

void startAdv(void)
{
  // Advertising packet
  Bluefruit.Advertising.addFlags(BLE_GAP_ADV_FLAGS_LE_ONLY_GENERAL_DISC_MODE);
  Bluefruit.Advertising.addTxPower();

  // Include bleuart 128-bit uuid
  Bluefruit.Advertising.addService(bleuart);

  // Secondary Scan Response packet (optional)
  // Since there is no room for 'Name' in Advertising packet
  Bluefruit.ScanResponse.addName();
  
  /* Start Advertising
   * - Enable auto advertising if disconnected
   * - Interval:  fast mode = 20 ms, slow mode = 152.5 ms
   * - Timeout for fast mode is 30 seconds
   * - Start(timeout) with timeout = 0 will advertise forever (until connected)
   * 
   * For recommended advertising interval
   * https://developer.apple.com/library/content/qa/qa1931/_index.html   
   */
  Bluefruit.Advertising.restartOnDisconnect(true);
  Bluefruit.Advertising.setInterval(32, 244);    // in unit of 0.625 ms
  Bluefruit.Advertising.setFastTimeout(30);      // number of seconds in fast mode
  Bluefruit.Advertising.start(0);                // 0 = Don't stop advertising after n seconds  
}

/*==============================================================================
 * LOOP()
 *============================================================================*/
void loop()
{
  // Skip if not connected and bleuart notification is not enabled
  if (  !(Bluefruit.connected() && bleuart.notifyEnabled()) ) return;
  
  byte pin, analogPin;

  /* DIGITALREAD - as fast as possible, check for changes and output them to the
   * FTDI buffer using Serial.print()  */
  checkDigitalInputs();

  /* STREAMREAD - processing incoming messagse as soon as possible, while still
   * checking digital inputs.  */
  while (Firmata.available())
    Firmata.processInput();

  // TODO - ensure that Stream buffer doesn't go over 60 bytes

  currentMillis = millis();
  if (currentMillis - previousMillis > samplingInterval) {
    previousMillis += samplingInterval;
    /* ANALOGREAD - do all analogReads() at the configured sampling interval */
    for (pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
      if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin) && Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_ANALOG) {
        analogPin = PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin);
        if (analogInputsToReport & (1 << analogPin)) {
          Firmata.sendAnalog(analogPin, analogRead( ANALOG_TO_PIN(analogPin) ));
        }
      }
    }
    // report i2c data for all device with read continuous mode enabled
    if (queryIndex > -1) {
      for (byte i = 0; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
        readAndReportData(query[i].addr, query[i].reg, query[i].bytes, query[i].stopTX);
      }
    }
  }

#ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  serialFeature.update();
#endif

  // flush TXD since we use bufferTXD()
  bleuart.flushTXD();
}

  1. /*
  2.   Firmata is a generic protocol for communicating with microcontrollers
  3.   from software on a host computer. It is intended to work with
  4.   any host computer software package.
  5.  
  6.   To download a host software package, please click on the following link
  7.   to open the list of Firmata client libraries in your default browser.
  8.  
  9.   https://github.com/firmata/arduino#firmata-client-libraries
  10.  
  11.   Copyright (C) 2006-2008 Hans-Christoph Steiner.  All rights reserved.
  12.   Copyright (C) 2010-2011 Paul Stoffregen.  All rights reserved.
  13.   Copyright (C) 2009 Shigeru Kobayashi.  All rights reserved.
  14.   Copyright (C) 2009-2016 Jeff Hoefs.  All rights reserved.
  15.  
  16.   This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or
  17.   modify it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public
  18.   License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either
  19.   version 2.1 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.
  20.  
  21.   See file LICENSE.txt for further informations on licensing terms.
  22.  
  23.   Last updated October 16th, 2016
  24. */
  25.  
  26. // Adafruit nRF52 Boards require Firmata at least 2.5.7
  27.  
  28. #include <bluefruit.h>
  29. #include <Servo.h>
  30. #include <Wire.h>
  31. #include <Firmata.h>
  32.  
  33. #define I2C_WRITE                   B00000000
  34. #define I2C_READ                    B00001000
  35. #define I2C_READ_CONTINUOUSLY       B00010000
  36. #define I2C_STOP_READING            B00011000
  37. #define I2C_READ_WRITE_MODE_MASK    B00011000
  38. #define I2C_10BIT_ADDRESS_MODE_MASK B00100000
  39. #define I2C_END_TX_MASK             B01000000
  40. #define I2C_STOP_TX                 1
  41. #define I2C_RESTART_TX              0
  42. #define I2C_MAX_QUERIES             8
  43. #define I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED  -1
  44.  
  45. // the minimum interval for sampling analog input
  46. #define MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL   1
  47.  
  48. // Adafruit
  49. uint8_t ANALOG_TO_PIN(uint8_t n)
  50. {
  51.   switch (n)
  52.   {
  53.     case 0 : return PIN_A0;
  54.     case 1 : return PIN_A1;
  55.     case 2 : return PIN_A2;
  56.     case 3 : return PIN_A3;
  57.     case 4 : return PIN_A4;
  58.     case 5 : return PIN_A5;
  59.     case 6 : return PIN_A6;
  60.     case 7 : return PIN_A7;
  61.   }
  62.  
  63.   return 127;
  64. }
  65.  
  66.  
  67. /*==============================================================================
  68.  * GLOBAL VARIABLES
  69.  *============================================================================*/
  70.  
  71. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  72. SerialFirmata serialFeature;
  73. #endif
  74.  
  75. BLEUart bleuart;
  76.  
  77. /* analog inputs */
  78. int analogInputsToReport = 0; // bitwise array to store pin reporting
  79.  
  80. /* digital input ports */
  81. byte reportPINs[TOTAL_PORTS];       // 1 = report this port, 0 = silence
  82. byte previousPINs[TOTAL_PORTS];     // previous 8 bits sent
  83.  
  84. /* pins configuration */
  85. byte portConfigInputs[TOTAL_PORTS]; // each bit: 1 = pin in INPUT, 0 = anything else
  86.  
  87. /* timer variables */
  88. unsigned long currentMillis;        // store the current value from millis()
  89. unsigned long previousMillis;       // for comparison with currentMillis
  90. unsigned int samplingInterval = 19; // how often to run the main loop (in ms)
  91.  
  92. /* i2c data */
  93. struct i2c_device_info {
  94.   byte addr;
  95.   int reg;
  96.   byte bytes;
  97.   byte stopTX;
  98. };
  99.  
  100. /* for i2c read continuous more */
  101. i2c_device_info query[I2C_MAX_QUERIES];
  102.  
  103. byte i2cRxData[64];
  104. boolean isI2CEnabled = false;
  105. signed char queryIndex = -1;
  106. // default delay time between i2c read request and Wire.requestFrom()
  107. unsigned int i2cReadDelayTime = 0;
  108.  
  109. Servo servos[MAX_SERVOS];
  110. byte servoPinMap[TOTAL_PINS];
  111. byte detachedServos[MAX_SERVOS];
  112. byte detachedServoCount = 0;
  113. byte servoCount = 0;
  114.  
  115. boolean isResetting = false;
  116.  
  117. // Forward declare a few functions to avoid compiler errors with older versions
  118. // of the Arduino IDE.
  119. void setPinModeCallback(byte, int);
  120. void reportAnalogCallback(byte analogPin, int value);
  121. void sysexCallback(byte, byte, byte*);
  122.  
  123. /* utility functions */
  124. void wireWrite(byte data)
  125. {
  126. #if ARDUINO >= 100
  127.   Wire.write((byte)data);
  128. #else
  129.   Wire.send(data);
  130. #endif
  131. }
  132.  
  133. byte wireRead(void)
  134. {
  135. #if ARDUINO >= 100
  136.   return Wire.read();
  137. #else
  138.   return Wire.receive();
  139. #endif
  140. }
  141.  
  142. /*==============================================================================
  143.  * FUNCTIONS
  144.  *============================================================================*/
  145.  
  146. void attachServo(byte pin, int minPulse, int maxPulse)
  147. {
  148.   if (servoCount < MAX_SERVOS) {
  149.     // reuse indexes of detached servos until all have been reallocated
  150.     if (detachedServoCount > 0) {
  151.       servoPinMap[pin] = detachedServos[detachedServoCount - 1];
  152.       if (detachedServoCount > 0) detachedServoCount--;
  153.     } else {
  154.       servoPinMap[pin] = servoCount;
  155.       servoCount++;
  156.     }
  157.     if (minPulse > 0 && maxPulse > 0) {
  158.       servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attach(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), minPulse, maxPulse);
  159.     } else {
  160.       servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attach(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin));
  161.     }
  162.   } else {
  163.     Firmata.sendString("Max servos attached");
  164.   }
  165. }
  166.  
  167. void detachServo(byte pin)
  168. {
  169.   servos[servoPinMap[pin]].detach();
  170.   // if we're detaching the last servo, decrement the count
  171.   // otherwise store the index of the detached servo
  172.   if (servoPinMap[pin] == servoCount && servoCount > 0) {
  173.     servoCount--;
  174.   } else if (servoCount > 0) {
  175.     // keep track of detached servos because we want to reuse their indexes
  176.     // before incrementing the count of attached servos
  177.     detachedServoCount++;
  178.     detachedServos[detachedServoCount - 1] = servoPinMap[pin];
  179.   }
  180.  
  181.   servoPinMap[pin] = 255;
  182. }
  183.  
  184. void enableI2CPins()
  185. {
  186.   byte i;
  187.   // is there a faster way to do this? would probaby require importing
  188.   // Arduino.h to get SCL and SDA pins
  189.   for (i = 0; i < TOTAL_PINS; i++) {
  190.     if (IS_PIN_I2C(i)) {
  191.       // mark pins as i2c so they are ignore in non i2c data requests
  192.       setPinModeCallback(i, PIN_MODE_I2C);
  193.     }
  194.   }
  195.  
  196.   isI2CEnabled = true;
  197.  
  198.   Wire.begin();
  199. }
  200.  
  201. /* disable the i2c pins so they can be used for other functions */
  202. void disableI2CPins() {
  203.   isI2CEnabled = false;
  204.   // disable read continuous mode for all devices
  205.   queryIndex = -1;
  206. }
  207.  
  208. void readAndReportData(byte address, int theRegister, byte numBytes, byte stopTX) {
  209.   // allow I2C requests that don't require a register read
  210.   // for example, some devices using an interrupt pin to signify new data available
  211.   // do not always require the register read so upon interrupt you call Wire.requestFrom()
  212.   if (theRegister != I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED) {
  213.     Wire.beginTransmission(address);
  214.     wireWrite((byte)theRegister);
  215.     Wire.endTransmission(stopTX); // default = true
  216.     // do not set a value of 0
  217.     if (i2cReadDelayTime > 0) {
  218.       // delay is necessary for some devices such as WiiNunchuck
  219.       delayMicroseconds(i2cReadDelayTime);
  220.     }
  221.   } else {
  222.     theRegister = 0;  // fill the register with a dummy value
  223.   }
  224.  
  225.   Wire.requestFrom(address, numBytes);  // all bytes are returned in requestFrom
  226.  
  227.   // check to be sure correct number of bytes were returned by slave
  228.   if (numBytes < Wire.available()) {
  229.     Firmata.sendString("I2C: Too many bytes received");
  230.   } else if (numBytes > Wire.available()) {
  231.     Firmata.sendString("I2C: Too few bytes received");
  232.   }
  233.  
  234.   i2cRxData[0] = address;
  235.   i2cRxData[1] = theRegister;
  236.  
  237.   for (int i = 0; i < numBytes && Wire.available(); i++) {
  238.     i2cRxData[2 + i] = wireRead();
  239.   }
  240.  
  241.   // send slave address, register and received bytes
  242.   Firmata.sendSysex(SYSEX_I2C_REPLY, numBytes + 2, i2cRxData);
  243. }
  244.  
  245. void outputPort(byte portNumber, byte portValue, byte forceSend)
  246. {
  247.   // pins not configured as INPUT are cleared to zeros
  248.   portValue = portValue & portConfigInputs[portNumber];
  249.   // only send if the value is different than previously sent
  250.   if (forceSend || previousPINs[portNumber] != portValue) {
  251.     Firmata.sendDigitalPort(portNumber, portValue);
  252.     previousPINs[portNumber] = portValue;
  253.   }
  254. }
  255.  
  256. /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  257.  * check all the active digital inputs for change of state, then add any events
  258.  * to the Serial output queue using Serial.print() */
  259. void checkDigitalInputs(void)
  260. {
  261.   /* Using non-looping code allows constants to be given to readPort().
  262.    * The compiler will apply substantial optimizations if the inputs
  263.    * to readPort() are compile-time constants. */
  264.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 0 && reportPINs[0]) outputPort(0, readPort(0, portConfigInputs[0]), false);
  265.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 1 && reportPINs[1]) outputPort(1, readPort(1, portConfigInputs[1]), false);
  266.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 2 && reportPINs[2]) outputPort(2, readPort(2, portConfigInputs[2]), false);
  267.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 3 && reportPINs[3]) outputPort(3, readPort(3, portConfigInputs[3]), false);
  268.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 4 && reportPINs[4]) outputPort(4, readPort(4, portConfigInputs[4]), false);
  269.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 5 && reportPINs[5]) outputPort(5, readPort(5, portConfigInputs[5]), false);
  270.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 6 && reportPINs[6]) outputPort(6, readPort(6, portConfigInputs[6]), false);
  271.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 7 && reportPINs[7]) outputPort(7, readPort(7, portConfigInputs[7]), false);
  272.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 8 && reportPINs[8]) outputPort(8, readPort(8, portConfigInputs[8]), false);
  273.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 9 && reportPINs[9]) outputPort(9, readPort(9, portConfigInputs[9]), false);
  274.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 10 && reportPINs[10]) outputPort(10, readPort(10, portConfigInputs[10]), false);
  275.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 11 && reportPINs[11]) outputPort(11, readPort(11, portConfigInputs[11]), false);
  276.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 12 && reportPINs[12]) outputPort(12, readPort(12, portConfigInputs[12]), false);
  277.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 13 && reportPINs[13]) outputPort(13, readPort(13, portConfigInputs[13]), false);
  278.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 14 && reportPINs[14]) outputPort(14, readPort(14, portConfigInputs[14]), false);
  279.   if (TOTAL_PORTS > 15 && reportPINs[15]) outputPort(15, readPort(15, portConfigInputs[15]), false);
  280. }
  281.  
  282. // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  283. /* sets the pin mode to the correct state and sets the relevant bits in the
  284.  * two bit-arrays that track Digital I/O and PWM status
  285.  */
  286. void setPinModeCallback(byte pin, int mode)
  287. {
  288.   if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_IGNORE)
  289.     return;
  290.  
  291.   if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_I2C && isI2CEnabled && mode != PIN_MODE_I2C) {
  292.     // disable i2c so pins can be used for other functions
  293.     // the following if statements should reconfigure the pins properly
  294.     disableI2CPins();
  295.   }
  296.   if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin) && mode != PIN_MODE_SERVO) {
  297.     if (servoPinMap[pin] < MAX_SERVOS && servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
  298.       detachServo(pin);
  299.     }
  300.   }
  301.   if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
  302.     reportAnalogCallback(PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin), mode == PIN_MODE_ANALOG ? 1 : 0); // turn on/off reporting
  303.   }
  304.   if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  305.     if (mode == INPUT || mode == PIN_MODE_PULLUP) {
  306.       portConfigInputs[pin / 8] |= (1 << (pin & 7));
  307.     } else {
  308.       portConfigInputs[pin / 8] &= ~(1 << (pin & 7));
  309.     }
  310.   }
  311.   Firmata.setPinState(pin, 0);
  312.   switch (mode) {
  313.     case PIN_MODE_ANALOG:
  314.       if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
  315.         if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  316.           pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT);    // disable output driver
  317. #if ARDUINO <= 100
  318.           // deprecated since Arduino 1.0.1 - TODO: drop support in Firmata 2.6
  319.           digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW); // disable internal pull-ups
  320. #endif
  321.         }
  322.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
  323.       }
  324.       break;
  325.     case INPUT:
  326. // Adafruit: Input without pull up cause pin state changes randomly --> lots of transmission data     
  327. //      if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  328. //        pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT);    // disable output driver
  329. //#if ARDUINO <= 100
  330. //        // deprecated since Arduino 1.0.1 - TODO: drop support in Firmata 2.6
  331. //        digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW); // disable internal pull-ups
  332. //#endif
  333. //        Firmata.setPinMode(pin, INPUT);
  334. //      }
  335. //      break;
  336.     case PIN_MODE_PULLUP:
  337.       if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  338.         pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), INPUT_PULLUP);
  339.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_PULLUP);
  340.         Firmata.setPinState(pin, 1);
  341.       }
  342.       break;
  343.     case OUTPUT:
  344.       if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  345.         if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_PWM) {
  346.           // Disable PWM if pin mode was previously set to PWM.
  347.           digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), LOW);
  348.         }
  349.         pinMode(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), OUTPUT);
  350.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, OUTPUT);
  351.       }
  352.       break;
  353.     case PIN_MODE_PWM:
  354.       if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin)) {
  355.         pinMode(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), OUTPUT);
  356.         analogWrite(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), 0);
  357.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_PWM);
  358.       }
  359.       break;
  360.     case PIN_MODE_SERVO:
  361.       if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  362.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_SERVO);
  363.         if (servoPinMap[pin] == 255 || !servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
  364.           // pass -1 for min and max pulse values to use default values set
  365.           // by Servo library
  366.           attachServo(pin, -1, -1);
  367.         }
  368.       }
  369.       break;
  370.     case PIN_MODE_I2C:
  371.       if (IS_PIN_I2C(pin)) {
  372.         // mark the pin as i2c
  373.         // the user must call I2C_CONFIG to enable I2C for a device
  374.         Firmata.setPinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_I2C);
  375.       }
  376.       break;
  377.     case PIN_MODE_SERIAL:
  378. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  379.       serialFeature.handlePinMode(pin, PIN_MODE_SERIAL);
  380. #endif
  381.       break;
  382.     default:
  383.       Firmata.sendString("Unknown pin mode"); // TODO: put error msgs in EEPROM
  384.   }
  385.   // TODO: save status to EEPROM here, if changed
  386. }
  387.  
  388. /*
  389.  * Sets the value of an individual pin. Useful if you want to set a pin value but
  390.  * are not tracking the digital port state.
  391.  * Can only be used on pins configured as OUTPUT.
  392.  * Cannot be used to enable pull-ups on Digital INPUT pins.
  393.  */
  394. void setPinValueCallback(byte pin, int value)
  395. {
  396.   if (pin < TOTAL_PINS && IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  397.     if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT) {
  398.       Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
  399.       digitalWrite(PIN_TO_DIGITAL(pin), value);
  400.     }
  401.   }
  402. }
  403.  
  404. void analogWriteCallback(byte pin, int value)
  405. {
  406.   if (pin < TOTAL_PINS) {
  407.     switch (Firmata.getPinMode(pin)) {
  408.       case PIN_MODE_SERVO:
  409.         if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin))
  410.           servos[servoPinMap[pin]].write(value);
  411.         Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
  412.         break;
  413.       case PIN_MODE_PWM:
  414.         if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin))
  415.           analogWrite(PIN_TO_PWM(pin), value);
  416.         Firmata.setPinState(pin, value);
  417.         break;
  418.     }
  419.   }
  420. }
  421.  
  422. void digitalWriteCallback(byte port, int value)
  423. {
  424.   byte pin, lastPin, pinValue, mask = 1, pinWriteMask = 0;
  425.  
  426.   if (port < TOTAL_PORTS) {
  427.     // create a mask of the pins on this port that are writable.
  428.     lastPin = port * 8 + 8;
  429.     if (lastPin > TOTAL_PINS) lastPin = TOTAL_PINS;
  430.     for (pin = port * 8; pin < lastPin; pin++) {
  431.       // do not disturb non-digital pins (eg, Rx & Tx)
  432.       if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  433.         // do not touch pins in PWM, ANALOG, SERVO or other modes
  434.         if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT || Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == INPUT) {
  435.           pinValue = ((byte)value & mask) ? 1 : 0;
  436.           if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == OUTPUT) {
  437.             pinWriteMask |= mask;
  438.           } else if (Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == INPUT && pinValue == 1 && Firmata.getPinState(pin) != 1) {
  439.             // only handle INPUT here for backwards compatibility
  440. #if ARDUINO > 100
  441.             pinMode(pin, INPUT_PULLUP);
  442. #else
  443.             // only write to the INPUT pin to enable pullups if Arduino v1.0.0 or earlier
  444.             pinWriteMask |= mask;
  445. #endif
  446.           }
  447.           Firmata.setPinState(pin, pinValue);
  448.         }
  449.       }
  450.       mask = mask << 1;
  451.     }
  452.     writePort(port, (byte)value, pinWriteMask);
  453.   }
  454. }
  455.  
  456.  
  457. // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  458. /* sets bits in a bit array (int) to toggle the reporting of the analogIns
  459.  */
  460. //void FirmataClass::setAnalogPinReporting(byte pin, byte state) {
  461. //}
  462. void reportAnalogCallback(byte analogPin, int value)
  463. {
  464.   if (analogPin < TOTAL_ANALOG_PINS) {
  465.     if (value == 0) {
  466.       analogInputsToReport = analogInputsToReport & ~ (1 << analogPin);
  467.     } else {
  468.       analogInputsToReport = analogInputsToReport | (1 << analogPin);
  469.       // prevent during system reset or all analog pin values will be reported
  470.       // which may report noise for unconnected analog pins
  471.       if (!isResetting) {
  472.         // Send pin value immediately. This is helpful when connected via
  473.         // ethernet, wi-fi or bluetooth so pin states can be known upon
  474.         // reconnecting.
  475.         Firmata.sendAnalog(analogPin, analogRead( ANALOG_TO_PIN(analogPin) ) );
  476.       }
  477.     }
  478.   }
  479.   // TODO: save status to EEPROM here, if changed
  480. }
  481.  
  482. void reportDigitalCallback(byte port, int value)
  483. {
  484.   if (port < TOTAL_PORTS) {
  485.     reportPINs[port] = (byte)value;
  486.     // Send port value immediately. This is helpful when connected via
  487.     // ethernet, wi-fi or bluetooth so pin states can be known upon
  488.     // reconnecting.
  489.     if (value) outputPort(port, readPort(port, portConfigInputs[port]), true);
  490.   }
  491.   // do not disable analog reporting on these 8 pins, to allow some
  492.   // pins used for digital, others analog.  Instead, allow both types
  493.   // of reporting to be enabled, but check if the pin is configured
  494.   // as analog when sampling the analog inputs.  Likewise, while
  495.   // scanning digital pins, portConfigInputs will mask off values from any
  496.   // pins configured as analog
  497. }
  498.  
  499. /*==============================================================================
  500.  * SYSEX-BASED commands
  501.  *============================================================================*/
  502.  
  503. void sysexCallback(byte command, byte argc, byte *argv)
  504. {
  505.   byte mode;
  506.   byte stopTX;
  507.   byte slaveAddress;
  508.   byte data;
  509.   int slaveRegister;
  510.   unsigned int delayTime;
  511.  
  512.   switch (command) {
  513.     case I2C_REQUEST:
  514.       mode = argv[1] & I2C_READ_WRITE_MODE_MASK;
  515.       if (argv[1] & I2C_10BIT_ADDRESS_MODE_MASK) {
  516.         Firmata.sendString("10-bit addressing not supported");
  517.         return;
  518.       }
  519.       else {
  520.         slaveAddress = argv[0];
  521.       }
  522.  
  523.       // need to invert the logic here since 0 will be default for client
  524.       // libraries that have not updated to add support for restart tx
  525.       if (argv[1] & I2C_END_TX_MASK) {
  526.         stopTX = I2C_RESTART_TX;
  527.       }
  528.       else {
  529.         stopTX = I2C_STOP_TX; // default
  530.       }
  531.  
  532.       switch (mode) {
  533.         case I2C_WRITE:
  534.           Wire.beginTransmission(slaveAddress);
  535.           for (byte i = 2; i < argc; i += 2) {
  536.             data = argv[i] + (argv[i + 1] << 7);
  537.             wireWrite(data);
  538.           }
  539.           Wire.endTransmission();
  540.           delayMicroseconds(70);
  541.           break;
  542.         case I2C_READ:
  543.           if (argc == 6) {
  544.             // a slave register is specified
  545.             slaveRegister = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);
  546.             data = argv[4] + (argv[5] << 7);  // bytes to read
  547.           }
  548.           else {
  549.             // a slave register is NOT specified
  550.             slaveRegister = I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED;
  551.             data = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);  // bytes to read
  552.           }
  553.           readAndReportData(slaveAddress, (int)slaveRegister, data, stopTX);
  554.           break;
  555.         case I2C_READ_CONTINUOUSLY:
  556.           if ((queryIndex + 1) >= I2C_MAX_QUERIES) {
  557.             // too many queries, just ignore
  558.             Firmata.sendString("too many queries");
  559.             break;
  560.           }
  561.           if (argc == 6) {
  562.             // a slave register is specified
  563.             slaveRegister = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);
  564.             data = argv[4] + (argv[5] << 7);  // bytes to read
  565.           }
  566.           else {
  567.             // a slave register is NOT specified
  568.             slaveRegister = (int)I2C_REGISTER_NOT_SPECIFIED;
  569.             data = argv[2] + (argv[3] << 7);  // bytes to read
  570.           }
  571.           queryIndex++;
  572.           query[queryIndex].addr = slaveAddress;
  573.           query[queryIndex].reg = slaveRegister;
  574.           query[queryIndex].bytes = data;
  575.           query[queryIndex].stopTX = stopTX;
  576.           break;
  577.         case I2C_STOP_READING:
  578.           byte queryIndexToSkip;
  579.           // if read continuous mode is enabled for only 1 i2c device, disable
  580.           // read continuous reporting for that device
  581.           if (queryIndex <= 0) {
  582.             queryIndex = -1;
  583.           } else {
  584.             queryIndexToSkip = 0;
  585.             // if read continuous mode is enabled for multiple devices,
  586.             // determine which device to stop reading and remove it's data from
  587.             // the array, shifiting other array data to fill the space
  588.             for (byte i = 0; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
  589.               if (query[i].addr == slaveAddress) {
  590.                 queryIndexToSkip = i;
  591.                 break;
  592.               }
  593.             }
  594.  
  595.             for (byte i = queryIndexToSkip; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
  596.               if (i < I2C_MAX_QUERIES) {
  597.                 query[i].addr = query[i + 1].addr;
  598.                 query[i].reg = query[i + 1].reg;
  599.                 query[i].bytes = query[i + 1].bytes;
  600.                 query[i].stopTX = query[i + 1].stopTX;
  601.               }
  602.             }
  603.             queryIndex--;
  604.           }
  605.           break;
  606.         default:
  607.           break;
  608.       }
  609.       break;
  610.     case I2C_CONFIG:
  611.       delayTime = (argv[0] + (argv[1] << 7));
  612.  
  613.       if (delayTime > 0) {
  614.         i2cReadDelayTime = delayTime;
  615.       }
  616.  
  617.       if (!isI2CEnabled) {
  618.         enableI2CPins();
  619.       }
  620.  
  621.       break;
  622.     case SERVO_CONFIG:
  623.       if (argc > 4) {
  624.         // these vars are here for clarity, they'll optimized away by the compiler
  625.         byte pin = argv[0];
  626.         int minPulse = argv[1] + (argv[2] << 7);
  627.         int maxPulse = argv[3] + (argv[4] << 7);
  628.  
  629.         if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  630.           if (servoPinMap[pin] < MAX_SERVOS && servos[servoPinMap[pin]].attached()) {
  631.             detachServo(pin);
  632.           }
  633.           attachServo(pin, minPulse, maxPulse);
  634.           setPinModeCallback(pin, PIN_MODE_SERVO);
  635.         }
  636.       }
  637.       break;
  638.     case SAMPLING_INTERVAL:
  639.       if (argc > 1) {
  640.         samplingInterval = argv[0] + (argv[1] << 7);
  641.         if (samplingInterval < MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL) {
  642.           samplingInterval = MINIMUM_SAMPLING_INTERVAL;
  643.         }
  644.       } else {
  645.         //Firmata.sendString("Not enough data");
  646.       }
  647.       break;
  648.     case EXTENDED_ANALOG:
  649.       if (argc > 1) {
  650.         int val = argv[1];
  651.         if (argc > 2) val |= (argv[2] << 7);
  652.         if (argc > 3) val |= (argv[3] << 14);
  653.         analogWriteCallback(argv[0], val);
  654.       }
  655.       break;
  656.     case CAPABILITY_QUERY:
  657.       Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
  658.       Firmata.write(CAPABILITY_RESPONSE);
  659.       for (byte pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
  660.         if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  661.           Firmata.write((byte)INPUT);
  662.           Firmata.write(1);
  663.           Firmata.write((byte)PIN_MODE_PULLUP);
  664.           Firmata.write(1);
  665.           Firmata.write((byte)OUTPUT);
  666.           Firmata.write(1);
  667.         }
  668.         if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin)) {
  669.           Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
  670.           Firmata.write(10); // 10 = 10-bit resolution
  671.         }
  672.         if (IS_PIN_PWM(pin)) {
  673.           Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_PWM);
  674.           Firmata.write(DEFAULT_PWM_RESOLUTION);
  675.         }
  676.         if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(pin)) {
  677.           Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_SERVO);
  678.           Firmata.write(14);
  679.         }
  680.         if (IS_PIN_I2C(pin)) {
  681.           Firmata.write(PIN_MODE_I2C);
  682.           Firmata.write(1);  // TODO: could assign a number to map to SCL or SDA
  683.         }
  684. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  685.         serialFeature.handleCapability(pin);
  686. #endif
  687.         Firmata.write(127);
  688.       }
  689.       Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
  690.       break;
  691.     case PIN_STATE_QUERY:
  692.       if (argc > 0) {
  693.         byte pin = argv[0];
  694.         Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
  695.         Firmata.write(PIN_STATE_RESPONSE);
  696.         Firmata.write(pin);
  697.         if (pin < TOTAL_PINS) {
  698.           Firmata.write(Firmata.getPinMode(pin));
  699.           Firmata.write((byte)Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0x7F);
  700.           if (Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0xFF80) Firmata.write((byte)(Firmata.getPinState(pin) >> 7) & 0x7F);
  701.           if (Firmata.getPinState(pin) & 0xC000) Firmata.write((byte)(Firmata.getPinState(pin) >> 14) & 0x7F);
  702.         }
  703.         Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
  704.       }
  705.       break;
  706.     case ANALOG_MAPPING_QUERY:
  707.       Firmata.write(START_SYSEX);
  708.       Firmata.write(ANALOG_MAPPING_RESPONSE);
  709.       for (byte pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
  710.         Firmata.write(IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin) ? PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin) : 127);
  711.       }
  712.       Firmata.write(END_SYSEX);
  713.       break;
  714.  
  715.     case SERIAL_MESSAGE:
  716. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  717.       serialFeature.handleSysex(command, argc, argv);
  718. #endif
  719.       break;
  720.   }
  721. }
  722.  
  723. /*==============================================================================
  724.  * SETUP()
  725.  *============================================================================*/
  726.  
  727. void systemResetCallback()
  728. {
  729.   isResetting = true;
  730.  
  731.   // initialize a defalt state
  732.   // TODO: option to load config from EEPROM instead of default
  733.  
  734. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  735.   serialFeature.reset();
  736. #endif
  737.  
  738.   if (isI2CEnabled) {
  739.     disableI2CPins();
  740.   }
  741.  
  742.   for (byte i = 0; i < TOTAL_PORTS; i++) {
  743.     reportPINs[i] = false;    // by default, reporting off
  744.     portConfigInputs[i] = 0;  // until activated
  745.     previousPINs[i] = 0;
  746.   }
  747.  
  748.   for (byte i = 0; i < TOTAL_PINS; i++) {
  749.     // pins with analog capability default to analog input
  750.     // otherwise, pins default to digital output
  751.     if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(i)) {
  752.       // turns off pullup, configures everything
  753.       setPinModeCallback(i, PIN_MODE_ANALOG);
  754.     } else if (IS_PIN_DIGITAL(i)) {
  755.       // sets the output to 0, configures portConfigInputs
  756.       setPinModeCallback(i, OUTPUT);
  757.     }
  758.  
  759.     servoPinMap[i] = 255;
  760.   }
  761.   // by default, do not report any analog inputs
  762.   analogInputsToReport = 0;
  763.  
  764.   detachedServoCount = 0;
  765.   servoCount = 0;
  766.  
  767.   /* send digital inputs to set the initial state on the host computer,
  768.    * since once in the loop(), this firmware will only send on change */
  769.   /*
  770.   TODO: this can never execute, since no pins default to digital input
  771.         but it will be needed when/if we support EEPROM stored config
  772.   for (byte i=0; i < TOTAL_PORTS; i++) {
  773.     outputPort(i, readPort(i, portConfigInputs[i]), true);
  774.   }
  775.   */
  776.   isResetting = false;
  777. }
  778.  
  779. void setup()
  780. {
  781.   Serial.begin(115200);
  782.   while ( !Serial ) delay(10);   // for nrf52840 with native usb
  783.  
  784.   Serial.println("Bluefruit52 Standard Firmata via BLEUART Example");
  785.   Serial.println("------------------------------------------------\n");
  786.  
  787.   // Config the peripheral connection with maximum bandwidth 
  788.   // more SRAM required by SoftDevice
  789.   // Note: All config***() function must be called before begin()
  790.   Bluefruit.configPrphBandwidth(BANDWIDTH_MAX);
  791.   
  792.   Bluefruit.begin();
  793.   Bluefruit.setName("Bluefruit52");
  794.   Bluefruit.setTxPower(4);    // Check bluefruit.h for supported values
  795.   
  796.   // try to go as fast as possible, could be rejected by some central, increase it if needed
  797.   // iOS won't negotitate and will mostly use 30ms
  798.   Bluefruit.Periph.setConnInterval(9, 24); // min = 9*1.25=11.25 ms, max = 23*1.25=30ms
  799.   
  800.   // Configure and Start BLE Uart Service
  801.   // Firmata use several small write(1) --> buffering TXD is required to run smoothly
  802.   // Enable buffering TXD
  803.   bleuart.begin();
  804.   bleuart.bufferTXD(true);
  805.   
  806.   Firmata.setFirmwareVersion(FIRMATA_FIRMWARE_MAJOR_VERSION, FIRMATA_FIRMWARE_MINOR_VERSION);
  807.  
  808.   Firmata.attach(ANALOG_MESSAGE, analogWriteCallback);
  809.   Firmata.attach(DIGITAL_MESSAGE, digitalWriteCallback);
  810.   Firmata.attach(REPORT_ANALOG, reportAnalogCallback);
  811.   Firmata.attach(REPORT_DIGITAL, reportDigitalCallback);
  812.   Firmata.attach(SET_PIN_MODE, setPinModeCallback);
  813.   Firmata.attach(SET_DIGITAL_PIN_VALUE, setPinValueCallback);
  814.   Firmata.attach(START_SYSEX, sysexCallback);
  815.   Firmata.attach(SYSTEM_RESET, systemResetCallback);
  816.  
  817.   // use bleuart as transportation layer
  818.   Firmata.begin(bleuart);
  819.  
  820.   // to use a port other than Serial, such as Serial1 on an Arduino Leonardo or Mega,
  821.   // Call begin(baud) on the alternate serial port and pass it to Firmata to begin like this:
  822.   // Serial1.begin(57600);
  823.   // Firmata.begin(Serial1);
  824.   // However do not do this if you are using SERIAL_MESSAGE
  825.  
  826.   //Firmata.begin(57600);
  827.   //while (!Serial) {
  828.   //  ; // wait for serial port to connect. Needed for ATmega32u4-based boards and Arduino 101
  829.   //}
  830.  
  831.   systemResetCallback();  // reset to default config
  832.  
  833.   // Set up and start advertising
  834.   startAdv();  
  835. }
  836.  
  837. void startAdv(void)
  838. {
  839.   // Advertising packet
  840.   Bluefruit.Advertising.addFlags(BLE_GAP_ADV_FLAGS_LE_ONLY_GENERAL_DISC_MODE);
  841.   Bluefruit.Advertising.addTxPower();
  842.  
  843.   // Include bleuart 128-bit uuid
  844.   Bluefruit.Advertising.addService(bleuart);
  845.  
  846.   // Secondary Scan Response packet (optional)
  847.   // Since there is no room for 'Name' in Advertising packet
  848.   Bluefruit.ScanResponse.addName();
  849.   
  850.   /* Start Advertising
  851.    * - Enable auto advertising if disconnected
  852.    * - Interval:  fast mode = 20 ms, slow mode = 152.5 ms
  853.    * - Timeout for fast mode is 30 seconds
  854.    * - Start(timeout) with timeout = 0 will advertise forever (until connected)
  855.    * 
  856.    * For recommended advertising interval
  857.    * https://developer.apple.com/library/content/qa/qa1931/_index.html   
  858.    */
  859.   Bluefruit.Advertising.restartOnDisconnect(true);
  860.   Bluefruit.Advertising.setInterval(32, 244);    // in unit of 0.625 ms
  861.   Bluefruit.Advertising.setFastTimeout(30);      // number of seconds in fast mode
  862.   Bluefruit.Advertising.start(0);                // 0 = Don't stop advertising after n seconds  
  863. }
  864.  
  865. /*==============================================================================
  866.  * LOOP()
  867.  *============================================================================*/
  868. void loop()
  869. {
  870.   // Skip if not connected and bleuart notification is not enabled
  871.   if (  !(Bluefruit.connected() && bleuart.notifyEnabled()) ) return;
  872.   
  873.   byte pin, analogPin;
  874.  
  875.   /* DIGITALREAD - as fast as possible, check for changes and output them to the
  876.    * FTDI buffer using Serial.print()  */
  877.   checkDigitalInputs();
  878.  
  879.   /* STREAMREAD - processing incoming messagse as soon as possible, while still
  880.    * checking digital inputs.  */
  881.   while (Firmata.available())
  882.     Firmata.processInput();
  883.  
  884.   // TODO - ensure that Stream buffer doesn't go over 60 bytes
  885.  
  886.   currentMillis = millis();
  887.   if (currentMillis - previousMillis > samplingInterval) {
  888.     previousMillis += samplingInterval;
  889.     /* ANALOGREAD - do all analogReads() at the configured sampling interval */
  890.     for (pin = 0; pin < TOTAL_PINS; pin++) {
  891.       if (IS_PIN_ANALOG(pin) && Firmata.getPinMode(pin) == PIN_MODE_ANALOG) {
  892.         analogPin = PIN_TO_ANALOG(pin);
  893.         if (analogInputsToReport & (1 << analogPin)) {
  894.           Firmata.sendAnalog(analogPin, analogRead( ANALOG_TO_PIN(analogPin) ));
  895.         }
  896.       }
  897.     }
  898.     // report i2c data for all device with read continuous mode enabled
  899.     if (queryIndex > -1) {
  900.       for (byte i = 0; i < queryIndex + 1; i++) {
  901.         readAndReportData(query[i].addr, query[i].reg, query[i].bytes, query[i].stopTX);
  902.       }
  903.     }
  904.   }
  905.  
  906. #ifdef FIRMATA_SERIAL_FEATURE
  907.   serialFeature.update();
  908. #endif
  909.  
  910.   // flush TXD since we use bufferTXD()
  911.   bleuart.flushTXD();
  912. }

Central BLEUART

by Thach Ha

This example show you how to use Bluefruit52 as a Central to talk to other Bluefruit52 peripherals exposing the bleuart (AKA 'NUS') service.

Client Services

Since the Central role accesses the GATT server on the peripheral, we first need to declare a client bleuart instance using the BLEClientUart helper class. We can also conveniently read Device Information if BLEClientDis is also used.

Download: file
Copy Code 
BLEClientDis  clientDis;
BLEClientUart clientUart;

  1. BLEClientDis  clientDis;
  2. BLEClientUart clientUart;

Before we can configure client services, Bluefruit.begin() must be called with at least 1 for the number of concurrent connections supported in central mode. Since we won't be running the nRF52 as a peripheral in this instance, we will set the peripheral count to 0:

Download: file
Copy Code 
// Initialize Bluefruit with maximum connections as Peripheral = 0, Central = 1
Bluefruit.begin(0, 1);
  1. // Initialize Bluefruit with maximum connections as Peripheral = 0, Central = 1
  2. Bluefruit.begin(0, 1);

Afterward this, the client service(s) must be initialized by calling their begin() function, and you can setup any callbacks that you wish to use from the helper class:

Download: file
Copy Code 
// Configure DIS client
clientDis.begin();

// Init BLE Central Uart Serivce
clientUart.begin();
clientUart.setRxCallback(bleuart_rx_callback);
  1. // Configure DIS client
  2. clientDis.begin();
  3.  
  4. // Init BLE Central Uart Serivce
  5. clientUart.begin();
  6. clientUart.setRxCallback(bleuart_rx_callback);

Scanner

Let's start the advertising scanner to find a peripheral.

We'll hook up the scan result callback with setRxCallback(). 

Whenever advertising data is found by the scanner, it will be passed to this callback handler, and we can examine the advertising data there, and only connect to peripheral(s) that advertise the bleuart service.

Note: If the peripheral has multiple services and bleuart is not included in the UUID list in the advertising packet, you could optionally use another check such as matching the MAC address, name checking, using "another service", etc.

Once we find a peripheral that we wish to communicate with, call Bluefruit.Central.connect() to establish connection with it:

Download: file
Copy Code 
void setup()
{
  // Other set up .....

  /* Start Central Scanning
   * - Enable auto scan if disconnected
   * - Interval = 100 ms, window = 80 ms
   * - Don't use active scan
   * - Start(timeout) with timeout = 0 will scan forever (until connected)
   */
  Bluefruit.Scanner.setRxCallback(scan_callback);
  Bluefruit.Scanner.restartOnDisconnect(true);
  Bluefruit.Scanner.setInterval(160, 80); // in unit of 0.625 ms
  Bluefruit.Scanner.useActiveScan(false);
  Bluefruit.Scanner.start(0);                   // // 0 = Don't stop scanning after n seconds
}

/**
 * Callback invoked when scanner pick up an advertising data
 * @param report Structural advertising data
 */
void scan_callback(ble_gap_evt_adv_report_t* report)
{
  // Check if advertising contain BleUart service
  if ( Bluefruit.Scanner.checkReportForService(report, clientUart) )
  {
    Serial.print("BLE UART service detected. Connecting ... ");

    // Connect to device with bleuart service in advertising
    Bluefruit.Central.connect(report);
  }
}
  1. void setup()
  2. {
  3.   // Other set up .....
  4.  
  5.   /* Start Central Scanning
  6.    * - Enable auto scan if disconnected
  7.    * - Interval = 100 ms, window = 80 ms
  8.    * - Don't use active scan
  9.    * - Start(timeout) with timeout = 0 will scan forever (until connected)
  10.    */
  11.   Bluefruit.Scanner.setRxCallback(scan_callback);
  12.   Bluefruit.Scanner.restartOnDisconnect(true);
  13.   Bluefruit.Scanner.setInterval(160, 80); // in unit of 0.625 ms
  14.   Bluefruit.Scanner.useActiveScan(false);
  15.   Bluefruit.Scanner.start(0);                   // // 0 = Don't stop scanning after n seconds
  16. }
  17.  
  18. /**
  19.  * Callback invoked when scanner pick up an advertising data
  20.  * @param report Structural advertising data
  21.  */
  22. void scan_callback(ble_gap_evt_adv_report_t* report)
  23. {
  24.   // Check if advertising contain BleUart service
  25.   if ( Bluefruit.Scanner.checkReportForService(report, clientUart) )
  26.   {
  27.     Serial.print("BLE UART service detected. Connecting ... ");
  28.  
  29.     // Connect to device with bleuart service in advertising
  30.     Bluefruit.Central.connect(report);
  31.   }
  32. }

Central Role

You normally need to setup the Central mode device's connect callback, which fires when a connection is established/disconnected with a peripheral device. Alternatively you could poll the connection status with connected(), but callbacks help to simplify the code significantly: 

Download: file
Copy Code 
// Callbacks for Central
Bluefruit.Central.setConnectCallback(connect_callback);
Bluefruit.Central.setDisconnectCallback(disconnect_callback);
  1. // Callbacks for Central
  2. Bluefruit.Central.setConnectCallback(connect_callback);
